Pressure driven stokes flow

This demo show how to run a pressure-driven Hagen-Poiseuille flow using the stokes flow solver. The inputs are largely similar to stokes ldc. Here we will hilight the key differences

Running the demo

This demo use the rect.h5 mesh. Please follow the instructions on creating the h5 mesh from meshing. Once the mesh is created, navigate to apps/ and simply run

python3 incompressible_flow.py inputs/stokes_pressure_driven.inp

Input descriptions

The following are key differences in the input file from stokes_ldc

Boundary conditions here are pressure driven. This is specified through the Neumann condition described in stokes physics. Here we define the inlet pressure to 10 and outlet pressure to 1. The top and bottom walls are considered no-slip. Note that this is a Neumann, thus a weak imposition of the pressure condition

# Boundary conditions
inlet pressure = 10.0
outlet pressure = 1.0
BC1 = (1, pressure, face, inlet pressure)
BC2 = (2, wall, no slip)
BC3 = (3, pressure, face, outlet pressure)
BC4 = (4, wall, no slip)

Finally, this demo demonstrate how to control the linear algebra solver in PETSc. Here we use the gmres solver with the incomplete lu preconditioner. In the current stage, the controls are limited to basic krylov solver inputs for petsc

# Linear solver
solver type = gmres
pc type = ilu
ksp relative tolerance = 1e-8
ksp absolute tolerance = 1e-10
ksp maximum iterations = 1000
ksp monitor convergence = true
